verse.text: Paul, Silvanus, and Timothy, to the assembly of the Thessalonians in God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ: Grace to you and peace.
We give thanks to God always for all of you, making mention of you in our prayers,
unceasingly remembering your work produced by trust, your labor prompted by love, and your patient persistence inspired by the hope of our Lord Jesus Christ in the presence of our God and Father.
For we know, brothers and sisters loved by God, your selection;
because our Good News did not come to you in word alone, but also in power and in the Holy Spirit and with full conviction, just as you know what kind of men we proved to be among you for your sake.
And you became imitators of us and of the Lord, having welcomed the message in the midst of much crushing pressure with the joy of the Holy Spirit,
so that you became a model for all those who believe in Macedonia and in Achaia.
For from you the message of the Lord has echoed out, not only in Macedonia and Achaia, but in every place your faith toward God has gone forth, so that we have no need to say anything.
For they themselves report about us what kind of welcome we had among you, and how you turned to God from idols to serve as slaves to a living and true God,
and to wait for his Son from the heavens, whom he raised from the dead—Jesus, who rescues us from the coming wrath.
For you yourselves know, brothers, that our arrival among you was not a hollow event.

Instead, as you know, even after we had already suffered and been publicly insulted in Philippi, we were given the courage by our God to speak the King’s Good News of God to you in the face of intense opposition.
For our appeal does not arise from delusion, nor from impure motives, nor with a strategy of deceit.
On the contrary, just as we have been tested and approved by God to be entrusted with the Good News, this is how we speak: not as those trying to please people, but God, who tests our hearts.
For we never came with a word of flattery, as you know, nor with a mask to hide greed—God is our witness—
nor were we seeking public honor from humans, whether from you or from others.
Although we could have thrown our weight around as apostles of Christ, we became gentle in your midst, like a nursing mother nurturing her own children.
Having this kind of deep affection for you, we were delighted to share with you not only the King’s Good News of God but our very lives, because you had become so dear to us.
For you remember, brothers, our labor and toil; we worked night and day so as not to be a financial burden to any of you while we proclaimed to you the King’s Good News of God.
You are witnesses, and so is God, of how devoutly, justly, and blamelessly we behaved toward you who believe.
For you know how we treated each one of you like a father treats his own children—
exhorting you, encouraging you, and urging you to walk in a way worthy of the God who calls you into his own kingdom and honor.

And for this reason, we also thank God constantly: because when you received the word of God’s message that you heard from us, you accepted it not as a human word, but as it truly is—the word of God, which is also at work in you who believe.
For you, brothers, became imitators of the assemblies of God in Judea that are in Christ Jesus, because you suffered the same things from your own countrymen as they did from the Judeans—
who killed both the Lord Jesus and the prophets, and drove us out. They do not please God and are hostile to all people,
hindering us from speaking to the nations so that they might be saved. As a result, they are always filling up the measure of their sins. But at long last, the wrath has come upon them.
But we, brothers, when we were orphaned by being torn away from you for a short time—in person, but not in heart—we were all the more eager, with intense longing, to see you face to face.
For we wanted to come to you—I, Paul, tried more than once—but Satan blocked our way.
For who is our hope or joy or the victory wreath of our boasting? Is it not you, in the presence of our Lord Jesus at his royal arrival?
For you are our honor and our joy."[/SPEAKER]
Therefore, when we could no longer hold it in, we resolved to be left behind in Athens alone.
We sent Timothy—our brother and God’s coworker in the Good News of the Christ—to steady you and encourage you in your faith,
so that no one would be shaken by these crushing pressures. For you yourselves know that we are appointed to this.
Indeed, when we were with you, we told you in advance, "We are destined to be crushed," and as you know, that is exactly what happened.
For this reason, when I could no longer hold out, I sent him to find out about your faith, fearing that perhaps the Tempter had tested you and our hard work would end up being for nothing.
But now Timothy has just returned to us from you and brought the good news of your faith and love. He told us that you always have kind memories of us and long to see us, just as we long to see you.
Because of this, brothers, we were encouraged concerning you in the midst of all our own distress and crushing pressure through your faith.
For now we truly live, since you are standing firm in the Lord.
How can we possibly render enough thanks to God for you in return for all the joy we feel because of you in the presence of our God?
Night and day we keep praying beyond all measure to see you face-to-face and to supply what is still lacking in your faith.
Now may our God and Father himself and our Lord Jesus clear the way for us to reach you.
And may the Lord cause you to increase and overflow in love for one another and for everyone—just as we do for you—
so that he may steady your hearts, making them blameless in holiness before our God and Father at the royal arrival of our Lord Jesus with all his holy ones.

Finally then, brothers and sisters, we ask and urge you in the Lord Jesus: just as you received from us the tradition of how you must walk—that is, how to conduct your lives—to please God (just as you are indeed walking), we urge you to excel in this even more.
For you know what instructions we gave you through the authority of the Lord Jesus.
For this is the will of God: your consecration. Specifically, that you distance yourselves from sexual immorality;
that each of you knows how to master his own vessel in consecration and honor,
not in the passion of lust like the nations who do not know God;

and that no one oversteps boundaries to exploit his brother or sister in this matter. For the Lord is the one who exacts justice concerning all these things, just as we told you before and solemnly warned you.
For God did not call us to a state of impurity, but to live within consecration.
Therefore, the one who rejects this is not rejecting a human being, but God—the very one who gives His Holy Spirit into you.
Now, regarding "brother-love," you have no need for anyone to write to you, for you yourselves are *theodidaktoi*—taught by God—to love one another.
Indeed, you are doing this for all the brothers and sisters throughout the whole of Macedonia. But we urge you, brothers and sisters, to excel in this even more,
and to make it your ambition to live a quiet life, to mind your own business, and to work with your own hands, just as we commanded you,
so that you may walk with dignity before those on the outside and have need of nothing.
We do not want you to be in the dark, brothers and sisters, concerning those who are sleeping, so that you do not grieve like the rest of the people who have no hope.
For if we believe that Jesus died and rose again, even so, through Jesus, God will bring with Him those who have fallen asleep.
For we say this to you by a word of the Lord: that we who are alive, who are left behind until the *Parousia* of the Lord, will certainly not precede those who have fallen asleep.
For the Lord himself, with a shout of command, with the voice of an archangel, and with the trumpet of God, will descend from heaven, and the dead in Christ will rise first.
Then we who are alive, who are left behind, will be snatched away together with them in the clouds to meet the Lord in the air—joining his royal procession—and so we will always be with the Lord.
Therefore, encourage one another with these words.
Regarding the chronological spans and the decisive moments, brothers and sisters, you have no need for anything to be written to you.
For you yourselves know with precise clarity that the Day of the Lord comes in the same way a thief comes in the night.
Whenever people are saying, "Peace and security," then sudden destruction comes upon them like birth-throes upon a pregnant woman, and they will certainly not escape.
But you, brothers and sisters, are not in darkness, so that the Day should catch you by surprise like a thief.
For you are all children of light and children of day. We do not belong to the night or to the darkness.
So then, let us not sleep as the rest do, but let us stay alert and stay sober.
For those who sleep, sleep at night, and those who get drunk, get drunk at night.
But since we belong to the day, let us be sober, putting on the breastplate of faith and love, and as a helmet, the hope of salvation.
For God did not appoint us to experience wrath, but to the acquisition of salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ,
who died for us so that whether we are alert or whether we sleep, we might live together with him.
Therefore, encourage one another and build each other up, just as you are already doing.
Now we ask you, brothers and sisters, to recognize those who toil among you—those who stand before you in the Lord and warn you.
Regard them with extraordinary love because of their work. Be at peace among yourselves.
And we urge you, brothers and sisters: warn the undisciplined, comfort the discouraged, take hold of the weak, and be patient with everyone.
See to it that no one repays evil for evil to anyone, but always pursue what is good for one another and for everyone.
Rejoice always.
Pray without ceasing.
Give thanks in every circumstance; for this is God’s will in Christ Jesus for you.
Do not extinguish the Spirit.
Do not treat prophecies with contempt.
But test everything; hold tightly to what is good.
Keep away from every form of evil.
May the God of peace himself set you apart as holy in every way, and may your entire being—spirit, soul, and body—be kept blameless at the Royal Presence of our Lord Jesus Christ.
The one who calls you is faithful, and he will bring it to pass.
Brothers and sisters, pray for us.
Greet all the brothers and sisters with a holy kiss.
I charge you under oath before the Lord to have this letter read to all the brothers and sisters.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
